tool.name: ImportActivityRoutes
tool.displayname: Import Strava Activity Routes to Feature Class

param.name: workspace
param.dialogReference: The local workspace to be used. Defaults to the current environment file geodatabase.

param.name: overwriteOutput
param.dialogReference: Boolean value allowing you to overwrite existing items in the workspace.

param.name: pathToStravaCredsJson
param.displayname: File Path to Strava API Credentials JSON
param.dialogReference:
Provide the absolute path to the populated JSON object containing your Strava Client ID (as an integer), Client Secret (as a quoted string), Access Token (as a quoted string), and Refresh Token (as a quoted string). The tool will add an an entry for "Expires_At" whenever it has to refresh an expired Access Token.

The JSON file (be sure to leave the file extension as .json) should have the following format:

{"strava": {"client_id": 12345, "client_secret": "1a2b3c.....4d5e", "access_token": "1a2b3c.....4d5e", "refresh_token": "1a2b3c.....4d5e"} }

param.name: outputFcName
param.dialogReference: Name of the output Feature Class. This feature class will be stored in the File Geodatabase set above.

param.name: startDatetimeString
param.dialogReference:
Select a Starting Date & Time to request activities from. The selected time will be interpreted as the local time of ArcGIS Pro and interpreted to UTC before making the Strava API GET request.

Defaults to the 30 days before the current date & time (the default ending datetime), using local timezone of ArcGIS Pro.

param.name: endDatetimeString
param.dialogReference:
Select an Ending Date & Time to request activities from. The selected time will be interpreted as the local time of ArcGIS Pro and interpreted to UTC before making the Strava API GET request.

Defaults to the the current date & time, using local timezone of ArcGIS Pro.

param.name: activityTypeSubstring
param.expression: Run | AlpineSki | BackcountrySki | Canoeing | EBikeRide | Elliptical | Golf | Hike | IceSkate | InlineSkate | Kayaking | Kitesurf | NordicSki | Ride | RollerSki | Rowing | Sail | Skateboard | Snowboard | Snowshoe | StandUpPaddling | Surfing | Swim | Velomobile | VirtualRide | VirtualRun | Walk
param.dialogReference:
Select one of listed Strava Activity Types to pull all matching activities for.

Defaults to "Run".

param.name: srid
param.dialogReference:
Provide an integer Well-Known ID for a Spatial Reference.

Defaults to 4326, (WGS84), which is the Spatial Reference typically used for encoded polylines.

param.name: verbose
param.dialogReference: Boolean value providing verbose Informational logging in the "Messages" of the geoprocessing history. Errors and Warnings will still be displayed when this is False.

tool.summary: Request activities from Strava's Athlete API to return encoded polyline objects, which are decoded and output as a Polyline feature class in the project file geodatabase.
tool.usage: This tool requires you to import the polyline package into your ArcGIS Conda environment (conda install -n arcgispro-py3 polyline). It also requires you to add an API Application to your Strava account (link here). From My API Application, copy our your Client ID (as an integer), Client Secret (as a string in quotes), Access Token (as a string in quotes), and Refresh Token (as a string in quotes) into the provided strava_api_auth_template.json file template. Rename it as you like, but be sure to leave the .json file extension.
